pr_title: testListenInvalidPort now valid for Windows and OSX

timeline.message:
testListenInvalidPort now valid for Windows and OSX

Signed-off-by: Gordon Hutchison <Gordon.Hutchison@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: the occupied server socket should be closed in a finally block surrounding this
timeline.author: vietj

replies.bodyText:
Please correct me if I am wrong but:

The occupied resource is opened in the try-with-resources
ServerSocket implements java.io.Closeable which extends AutoCloseable
The await() will prevent the try-with-resources AutoClosing the socket before
the test has executed.
The try-with-resources will close() the socket at the end
The (parent) pom requires Java 1.8+ which has try with resources

I do see the code is not obvious if read quickly and I tried to talk to this above in "The socket is Closable so the try with resources should close the port (after the await) ". I apologise that I did not put a comment this effect in the code (and also for the use of port 0 result of assigning a free port) but the rest of the tests are not very wordy so I was trying to adopt the same style.
replies.author: hutchig

replies.bodyText: ServerSocket is autoclosable and occupied is closed by the try-with-resources statement
replies.author: hutchig

replies.bodyText: indeed that's very correct, I am not using this pattern as we don't use it often with non blocking resources
replies.author: vietj
